abstract: Yale U. Press to publish lost one act play by Eugene O'Neill in book form.
snippet: Yale U. Press to publish lost one act play by Eugene O'Neill in book form.
lead_paragraph: In 1912, the 24-year-old Eugene O'Neill tried to kill himself with an overdose of Veronal, but botched the job and was found unconscious by friends. He later wrote about the experience in an autobiographical one-act play, "Exorcism," which ends with the O'Neill character, Ned Malloy, experiencing a kind of resurrection. "The Past is finally cremated," he says. "I feel reborn, I tell you."

headline.main: Yale Press to Publish Forgotten Eugene O'Neill One-Act in Book Form
